intro: Brodiaea ida-maia, commonly known as the Ida-Maia brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces tall, slender stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to dry, rocky environments. Brodiaea ida-maia is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, where it blooms in late spring to early summer.
